prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'West Brom have honoured the memory of former striker Jeff Astle on 'Astle Day' against Leicester City in Saturday's Premier League encounter. response: West Brom celebrated 'Astle Day' in their Premier League match against Leicester City to honor former striker Jeff Astle and launch the Jeff Astle Foundation. The choice of the Leicester match for the commemoration was made by Astle's widow, Laraine, marking 50 years since his West Brom debut against Leicester. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'West Ham have been dealt a blow by the news that Diafra Sakho could be out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Arsenal should target Chelsea goalkeeper Petr Cech if he leaves Stamford Bridge at the end of the season, insists Carlo Cudicini. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A mother who drove six children, including two of her own, to a residence just outside New Orleans so they could fight another group of juveniles, resulting in one child being shot, has been arrested. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A once in a lifetime shot, they said, but it appears Charlie Adam has done it before. The Stanley keeper tries desperately to stop the ball as it sails towards the goal. The goalkeeper is left sprawled on the floor as the ball hits the back of the net. And that is not the first time the Scot has had a goalkeeper frantically back-pedalling before picking the ball out of his own net. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Derry Mathews' world title challenge is in limbo after Richar Abril withdrew for a second time. The Cuban was due to face Mathews on April 18 in Liverpool in the second defence of his WBA lightweight belt. A statement from the 31-year-old's promoter read: 'We have been made aware of Abril's withdrawal and are in discussions with the World Boxing Association and representatives of Richar Abril as to the current position of the world title as this is the second time he has withdrawn from this fight with less than two weeks before fight night. 'We expect to hear from the WBA shortly and will make an announcement through this office. However, we fully expect Mathews to contest a version of the WBA world championship on Saturday, April 18.' Mathews tweeted: 'I am in this sport to fight the best but in my eyes Abril doesn't fancy this fight. I have spent 12 weeks away from my wife, family and home. 'He could of been a man and told me weeks ago, but I have the best manager and team round me who will get the best for me.'' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Derry Mathews' world title fight is uncertain after Richar Abril's second withdrawal from their scheduled bout on April 18 in Liverpool for the WBA lightweight championship. Mathews might still compete for the title if Abril is stripped of his belt by the WBA. Mathews, having recently defeated Gyorgy Mezei Jnr with a fifth-round knockout, and his team are in talks with the WBA and Abril's representatives regarding the title's status. Abril, who previously withdrew from their original March 6 fight date and has fought minimally since 2012, faces criticism from Mathews for his lack of commitment. Mathews and his team expect an update from the WBA soon and anticipate that he will still fight for a version of the WBA world championship on April 18.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Liverpool and Newcastle players took part in a minute silence before their Premier League match at Anfield on Monday night in memory of the 96 fans who died at Hillsborough almost 26 years ago. The fixture at Anfield, which took place two days before the 26th anniversary of the disaster, was preceded by a period of silence from both teams and the 45,000 fans gathered. Flowers were also laid at the club's Hillsborough memorial at Anfield, including some by former Newcastle captain Bobby Moncur. Anfield stood still for a moment before the game between Liverpool and Newcastle in memory of Hillsborough. Liverpool and Newcastle players both took part in a minute silence in memory of the 96 fans who died. Liverpool players lined up for the minute silence before they played Newcastle on Monday at Anfield. Banners in the Kop were held up in memory of the 96 supporters who died almost 26 years ago. During the period of silence and the pre-match You'll Never Walk Alone song, fans in the Kop held up banners in honour of the 96 victims on that fateful day in 1989. On 15 April 1989, 96 Liverpool fans were crushed to death during their FA Cup semi-final against Nottingham Forest at Sheffield Wednesday's Hillsborough home. It is widely regarded as the worst disaster in the history of English football and inquests are still ongoing into the tragedy in Warrington. Former Newcastle captain Bobby Moncur laid flowers at the Hillsborough memorial before the game. A supporter touches the Hillsborough memorial, which has been temporarily moved due to building work.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Before their Premier League match at Anfield, Liverpool and Newcastle players observed a minute's silence in memory of the 96 fans who died in the Hillsborough disaster nearly 26 years ago. The tribute took place two days before the 26th anniversary of the tragedy, with both teams and the 45,000 fans in attendance participating. Flowers were laid at the Hillsborough memorial at Anfield, including by former Newcastle captain Bobby Moncur. Banners were held up in the Kop in honor of the victims during the silence and the pre-match rendition of "You'll Never Walk Alone." The disaster, which occurred on April 15, 1989, during an FA Cup semi-final, is considered the worst in English football history, with ongoing inquests into the tragedy.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Barcelona goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen is keen to impress manager Luis Enrique in the Champions League having failed to make his La Liga debut since joining the club in the summer. Ter Stegen arrived at the Nou Camp from German outfit Borussia Monchengladbach in May but has struggled to get ahead of fellow summer-singing Claudio Bravo in the pecking order under Enrique. The 22-year-old has been reduced to Champions League appearances but the German international is confident of his ability and insists he's ready to become Barcelona's first-choice keeper in the league. 'It's not easy when you're not in the rhythm, but I'm playing in the Champions League so I don't lose my rhythm. I'm happy with this situation; it's fine for me. 'I obviously intend to play at a high level to show the boss that I can play more.' The 22-year-old is yet to make his La Liga debut for the Catalan giants in debut season at the Nou Camp.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Marc-Andre ter Stegen, Barcelona's goalkeeper, is determined to prove himself to manager Luis Enrique in the Champions League, as he has not yet debuted in La Liga since his transfer from Borussia Monchengladbach. Despite being second to Claudio Bravo in the team's goalkeeper hierarchy, the 22-year-old German international is confident in his abilities and aims to secure the first-choice goalkeeper position for league matches. Ter Stegen expressed his self-belief and desire to contribute to the team ahead of Barcelona's Champions League quarter-final against Paris Saint Germain.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Juventus goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon has no immediate plans to retire and said it would be a waste to quit now when he feels he is still in top form. 'A player stops when he feels that he is no longer what he was before on the pitch,' Buffon, 37, told reporters after Juventus beat Monaco 1-0 in the Champions League on Tuesday. 'Looking at it objectively, that is not my case. I will continue to keep playing as long as I am doing well, otherwise it would be a waste. Why bid farewell to football if you are playing well?' Juventus goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon says he is not thinking about retiring because he is still playing well. The Italy international produced a solid display to stop Monaco from scoring an away goal on Tuesday night. The Juventus captain celebrates after his side recorded a 1-0 win in the first leg of the quarter-final. 'At the first sign of slipping, I would be the first to bow out. I think one should stop playing when goes onto the field and you see that you are no longer the same person,' he added. Buffon, who has helped Juventus win three successive Serie A titles and is still Italy's first-choice goalkeeper, made three important saves to deny Monaco an away goal in Tuesday's game. Buffon joined Juventus from Parma in 2001, and stayed with them even after they were demoted to Serie B following the Calciopoli match-fixing scandal in 2006, the same year he helped Italy win the World Cup.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Gianluigi Buffon, the 37-year-old Juventus goalkeeper, has expressed his intention to continue playing football as he believes he is still in top form. Following Juventus' 1-0 victory over Monaco in the Champions League quarter-final, Buffon stated he would only consider retirement if he felt he was no longer performing at his best. He emphasized the importance of self-assessment in deciding when to end his career but feels that time has not yet come, citing his solid performance and crucial saves in the recent match. Buffon, who has been with Juventus since 2001 and remained loyal through the team's demotion in 2006, also highlighted his role in Juventus' three consecutive Serie A titles and his position as Italy's first-choice goalkeeper.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Veteran Leeds prop Kylie Leuluai is facing the prospect of another six weeks on the sidelines after being told he needs shoulder surgery. response: Kylie Leuluai, a veteran Leeds prop, is expected to miss another six weeks due to shoulder surgery, after being initially sidelined for a month following a defeat at Warrington. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'An Arkansas single dad has decided to change up his romance strategy by putting an ad on the side of his pickup truck after not finding love online. Thomas has three kids, aged six to 11, who he said that his kids think the sign is 'cute'. He added that most of his free time is when he kids are in school and he's not much of a party animal. And no need to worry about embarrassing his kids with the sign, Thomas said, because 'they think its cute'.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Robin Thomas, a single father from Jonesboro, Arkansas, has resorted to advertising for a girlfriend on his pickup truck after unsuccessful attempts at online dating. His ad, aimed at women aged 21 and up, seeks someone normal and down-to-earth, preferably around his age or at least 28. Thomas, a retired cook and a father of three children aged six to 11, enjoys activities like playing pool, bowling, barbecuing, and spending time at the river. He has joint custody of one son and prefers someone living nearby. Thomas's children find his unique approach to finding love 'cute'.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A southern Iowa chiropractor accused of accepting sex as payment for his services and performing exorcisms on patients has surrendered his state license. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Giving away healthy lead is enough to send most managers into a fit of rage. There are many players out there that could vouch for that. response: NAC Breda manager Robert Maaskant became enraged after his team surrendered a two-goal lead during a match against FC Dordrecht. Despite leading at halftime thanks to goals from Adnane Tighadouini, NAC, fighting against relegation, allowed Dordrecht to equalize with two quick goals. Maaskant's frustration boiled over as he punched the substitutes' bench, breaking the plastic casing and injuring his hand. His outburst underscored his intense dissatisfaction with his team's performance.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Argentina legend Diego Maradona lost his cool to kick out at a steward and lashed out at a cameraman at charity match. response: During a charity match in Bogota aimed at supporting peace in Colombia, Argentine football legend Diego Maradona displayed aggressive behavior by kicking a steward and lashing out at a cameraman after the game. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Sickening footage has surfaced of a teenage girl being struck by a fast moving car and flung into the air before appearing to land on her head. response: A teenage girl was hit by a car while standing in the middle of the road in Warrilla, resulting in her being flung into the air and landing on her head. The incident, which occurred around 1am on Wednesday, was captured in distressing footage. Despite the severe nature of the accident, the 15-year-old suffered only minor injuries and has been released from Shellharbour Hospital. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A quokka was the innocent victim of a cruel act by two French tourists who tried to set the Australian animal alight. Both men aged 18 and 24, and both currently living in Cockburn Central, were evicted from the island. They have each been charged with animal cruelty and will appear in Fremantle Magistrates Court on April 17. A small marsupial. The size of a domestic cat. Herbivorous and mainly nocturnal. Quokkas can be found on some small islands off the West Australian coast. In particular off Rottnest island off Perth and Bald Island near Albany. The lucky little critter survived the reckless incident but was singed by the flame and the men were charged.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Two French tourists were charged with animal cruelty for attempting to set a quokka alight using an aerosol spray and lighter on Rottnest Island, Western Australia, on April 3. The quokka was singed but survived. The men, aged 18 and 24, living in Cockburn Central, were evicted from the island after detectives seized video evidence. They are due in Fremantle Magistrates Court on April 17.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A grandmother held her daughter and two-year-old grandson hostage after abducting them with a Taser stun gun. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Piers Morgan says Arsenal should sack Arsene Wenger and replace him with Jurgen Klopp now that the Borussia Dortmund manager has announced his intention to leave the German club in the summer. 'Arsenal would be perfect for Jurgen Klopp - and he would be perfect for Arsenal,' Morgan wrote on Twitter. 'Sign him. 'If we don't sign Klopp, he will go to another top club and win trophies. Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Piers Morgan advocates for Arsenal to dismiss Arsene Wenger and hire Jurgen Klopp, who announced his departure from Borussia Dortmund and will be available from June. Morgan, a vocal critic of Wenger and a fan of Arsenal, believes Klopp, described as a "dynamic, driven young winner," would be a perfect fit for Arsenal, likening him to Mourinho. Despite Dortmund's struggles in the Bundesliga, Morgan emphasizes Klopp's achievements and warns that if Arsenal doesn't secure him, Klopp will likely lead another top club to victory.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Dani Alves insists he is yet to sign a pre-contract agreement with another club following rumours that the Brazilian is set to quit Barcelona this summer. It's very hard that we get to April and Barcelona haven't thought about renewing Dani's contract.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Dani Alves has denied signing a pre-contract agreement with any club amid rumors he will leave Barcelona this summer. Despite rejecting Barcelona's recent contract offer, Alves expressed his contentment at the club and his intention to fulfill his current contract with the same ambition he had upon arrival. The Brazilian defender, whose contract expires this summer, has attracted interest from clubs like Manchester United and Paris Saint-Germain. Alves emphasized his gratitude towards Barcelona and mentioned he would consider other options only if the club suggests he should.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Justin Rose admitted he lost to the better man as Jordan Spieth won his first Masters title in emphatic fashion. Justin Rose (left) congratulates Spieth after the young Texan holes his last shot on the 18th green. McIIroy shot an impressive last-round 66 but could only finish fourth behind Spieth, Rose and Phil Mickelson. Rose, who finished joint-second with Phil Mickelson on 14 under, said: 'Phenomenal, what a month of golf Jordan's had. Awesome composure; every time I thought there was a chink in the armour he would come out and hole an eight foot putt. 'Jordan seems to have that same quality right now and he's very comfortable playing with a lead. 14 under round here I'll take that every year and take my chances.' World No 1 Rory McIlroy, who needed to win to complete a career grand slam, finished fourth after a closing 66 and added: 'Jordan started fantastically well and has kept his foot down and been really impressive.' Tributes poured in for Spieth from his fellow players and other stars as the world reacted to the young Texan's impressive display.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Jordan Spieth won his first Masters title, finishing 18 under and becoming the second youngest winner after Tiger Woods. He also became the fourth player to reach 17 under and the only one to hit 19 under. Justin Rose and Phil Mickelson finished joint-second, four shots behind. Rory McIlroy finished fourth. Rose praised Spieth's composure and performance, while McIlroy highlighted Spieth's impressive start and ability to maintain his lead. Tributes to Spieth's victory came from fellow players and stars globally.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'British No 2 Aljaz Bedene was unable to sustain his strong run since switching allegiance from Slovenia, crashing out of the Grand Prix Hassan II in Casablanca in the last eight. The world No 99 had breezed past fellow-qualifier Arthur De Greef of Belgium in a 70-minute, straight-sets victory to set up his quarter-final clash - but was unable to dislodge Czech young gun Jiri Vesely on Friday. Vesely saw off Bedene 6-1 6-4 to reach the final four and tee up a clash with Spanish veteran Daniel Gimeno-Traver. Aljaz Bedene, who has switched from Slovenia to Great Britain, lost in Casablanca (not pictured) The 21-year-old rising Czech star put paid to Bedene's good start to life under the official British banner, after the London-based 25-year-old changed nationality last month. Vesely saw off Mikhail Youzhny on Thursday despite all his luggage being lost in transit from Rome and borrowing kit from doubles partner Frantisek Cermak. That victory ended a seven-match losing streak, and he continued his resurgence to sweep past Bedene without issue. Vesely's next opponent Gimeno-Traver dropped just six points on his first serve in a 6-4 6-3 victory over Lamine Ouahab. Second seed Martin Klizan saw off Nicolas Almagro 6-4 7-6 (6/3), meanwhile, denying his Spanish opponent a 250th career win on clay. Klizan will face Damir Dzumhur next after the Bosnian eased past sixth seed Andreas Haider-Maurer 6-3 6-3.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: British No 2 Aljaz Bedene, who recently switched allegiance from Slovenia to Great Britain, was eliminated from the Grand Prix Hassan II in Casablanca in the quarterfinals by Czech player Jiri Vesely. Despite a strong start and a victory over Arthur De Greef in the previous round, Bedene lost to Vesely 6-1 6-4. This win allowed Vesely to advance to the semifinals where he will face Spanish player Daniel Gimeno-Traver. The text also mentions other match outcomes, including victories by Martin Klizan and Damir Dzumhur, who will face each other in another semifinal match.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Australia World Cup-winner Aaron Finch must recover from a hamstring injury if he is to arrive on schedule to play for Yorkshire again this summer. response: Aaron Finch, an Australian World Cup-winner, has suffered a significant hamstring injury while playing for Mumbai Indians in the Indian Premier League, casting doubt on his ability to join Yorkshire for the upcoming summer season. Despite his hope to return to Yorkshire, where he played last summer, scans confirmed the damage, and Finch announced his likely absence from the remainder of the IPL season due to the injury.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Defending NBA champions San Antonio Spurs have stepped up their title defence preparation by taking part in an amusing music video which announced band Spuran Spuran. response: Defending NBA champions San Antonio Spurs participated in a humorous music video to kick off their title defense preparations, forming a band named Spuran Spuran in homage to Duran Duran. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Chris Ramsey watched his side hold off league leaders Chelsea for 88 minutes at Loftus Road in the west London derby. response: Chris Ramsey witnessed his QPR team resist Chelsea for 88 minutes in a west London derby at Loftus Road, before Cesc Fabregas scored a late winner, devastating Ramsey and the QPR fans. This goal put Chelsea closer to the Premier League title and worsened QPR's relegation fears. Chelsea extended their lead over Arsenal to seven points with a game in hand, while QPR remained in the relegation zone, two points from safety. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Stoke City have opened talks over a possible summer deal for Evian flyer Daniel Wass. response: Stoke City is in discussions for a potential summer acquisition of Evian's Daniel Wass, a 25-year-old Danish international, for around £3.5 million. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Lionel Messi wants Celtic back in the Champions League next season, so he can have the opportunity of playing in the 'best atmosphere in Europe' once more. The games against Celtic were special and I want to remember them,' he told the Daily Record. 'The performances of Fraser Forster against us were talked about for a long time. There was one game in Scotland where he was not human, it is the best goalkeeping performance I have seen. 'Celtic Park is a tough place to go to, it is never easy to get a result there. 'It is the best atmosphere in Europe and we all want to experience that again.' Messi (second left pictured in 2008) was on the scoresheet in his first match at Celtic in a 3-2 victory.' response: Lionel Messi has expressed his desire for Celtic to qualify for the Champions League next season to experience the "best atmosphere in Europe" at Celtic Park again. Despite having played there with Barcelona in 2008, 2012, and 2013, Messi looks forward to returning, recalling the electric environment and memorable games, particularly highlighting Fraser Forster's remarkable goalkeeping performance. Messi, who keeps a Celtic jersey at home, wishes for the opportunity to create more memories against Celtic, emphasizing the difficulty and excitement of playing at Celtic Park.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Celtic could win the Scottish Premiership title against closest rivals Aberdeen on May 10 – if both teams win all their games beforehand. response: Celtic could secure the Scottish Premiership title against Aberdeen on May 10 if both teams win their preceding matches. The victory would mark Celtic's fourth consecutive championship. The schedule does not include any Saturday league matches for Celtic, who have two Friday night games remaining. If successful, Celtic will receive the trophy on May 24 before their last home game against Inverness Caledonian Thistle. The season's final fixtures also involve a Dundee derby and a critical match for St Mirren, who is at risk of relegation and faces a potential play-off if they finish eleventh.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Barcelona's Champions League quarter-final first-leg win over Paris Saint-Germain has been lauded by the Spanish media. response: The Spanish media praised Barcelona's performance after their 3-1 victory over Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League quarter-final first leg, highlighted by goals from Luis Suarez and Neymar. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Atletico Madrid striker Mario Mandzukic has denied claims that Real Madrid defender Daniel Carvajal bit him during Tuesday's Champions League quarter-final match. response: Atletico Madrid's Mario Mandzukic and Real Madrid's Daniel Carvajal were involved in a physical altercation during a goalless Champions League quarter-final match, leading to claims Carvajal bit Mandzukic. Both players and Mandzukic, via a tweet, have denied these claims, emphasizing the game's intensity but dismissing the controversy. The incident, which saw Carvajal's mouth close to Mandzukic's forearm, occurred without the referee's notice. Mandzukic, who also suffered a cut eye from a clash with Sergio Ramos, is focusing on the upcoming games, downplaying the biting allegation.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'George Bailey is to join Sussex for the second half of their NatWest T20 Blast campaign this summer. response: George Bailey, the Australian batsman and former international captain, has signed with Sussex to play the second half of their NatWest T20 Blast campaign, following Mahela Jayawardene's stint for the first seven games. Bailey, who has a history with Hampshire and has led Australia in limited-overs formats, will also be available for the Royal London Cup. He expressed enthusiasm about joining Sussex, citing the quality of the team and the competitive nature of domestic cricket in England. Sussex's professional cricket manager, Mark Robinson, praised Bailey's one-day skills and leadership, highlighting the positive impact he is expected to have on the team.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Utrecht has twelve players on the pitch at one stage during Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ajax at the Stadion Galgenwaard. response: During a match between Utrecht and Ajax, which ended in a 1-1 draw, Utrecht accidentally had twelve players on the field after Edouard Duplan did not realize he had been substituted by Tommy Oar. The mistake was corrected after the referee intervened. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Chelsea are in early discussions over a possible partnership with Belgian club Royal Mouscron-Peruwelz. Mouscron, in Belgium's Pro League, had a partnership with Lille but the French side are now poised to link up with another Belgian club, Ostend, leaving room for a new deal and Chelsea are the preferred option. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Josh Warrington will be accompanied into the ring by Vinnie Jones on Saturday as he boxes in front of 10,000 passionate fans in Leeds. Nathan Cleverly celebrates his victory over Shawn Hawk in the WBO Light Heavyweight bout at the Staples Center in Los Angeles alongside actor Mickey Rourke (left) in November 2012. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'The anticipation has been ramped up ahead of next month's $300million mega fight between Floyd Mayweather Jnr and Manny Pacquiao. American television network Showtime has released a short promotional video from within the Mayweather camp as the build up to the May 2 bout at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. Mayweather works on the bag as he prepares for the Fight of the Century on May 2. Mayweather is down to within three-and-a-half pounds of the welterweight limit ahead of mega-fight. 'This is an unbelievable match-up,' Mayweather explains. 'I'm int he gym working right now, dedicating myself to the sport, pushing myself to the limit. Mayweather and Pacquiao have been documenting their training camps on social media and are now just a few weeks away from contesting the WBA, WBO and WBC welterweight titles. Mayweather was last week down to within three-and-a-half pounds of the 147 lbs welterweight limit when he weighed in for the mandatory check 30 days before the fight.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Ahead of the highly anticipated $300 million fight between Floyd Mayweather Jnr and Manny Pacquiao on May 2 at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas, Showtime released a promotional video showcasing Mayweather's training camp. The video highlights Mayweather's preparation, focus, and determination for what is dubbed the Fight of the Century. Mayweather, who is nearing the welterweight limit, expressed an unprecedented desire to win. Both fighters have been actively sharing their training progress on social media as they gear up to compete for the WBA, WBO, and WBC welterweight titles.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Karim Benzema insists Real Madrid are capable of becoming the first side to retain the Champions League due to their undoubted quality. The La Liga giants won their 10th European Cup last season and Benzema is confident that his side can quickly add to their impressive tally. Speaking to adidas football, Benzema said: 'We are trying to get to the final. Needless to say, we have a great team, who'll give their all to be there at the end. Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema believes his side are capable of retaining the Champions League. Benzema was speaking to adidas ahead of Real Madrid's Champions League encounter against Atletico. 'What makes us better than the rest is that we have the best players in the world. That's it and above all, that we play together and that makes the team stronger.' Benzema's club team-mate James Rodriguez, who has recently returned to full fitness following a foot injury, has heaped praise on Carlo Ancelotti ahead of Real's Champions League showdown with Atletico. 'He's a very experienced coach, he knows a lot. It's a pleasure to work with him,' said Rodriguez. James Rodriguez has said 'it's a pleasure to work with' Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti. The Colombia international and Real Madrid superster was speaking to adidas presenter Layla Anna-Lee. 'He trains a lot as well. I think that's very important when it comes to trying to win tournaments and achieve success.' When asked about the difference between playing in France and Spain, added Rodriguez: 'Not many. Football in France is extremely physical, extremely tacticial too. Here one can play a bit more, but overall both are leagues that know how to play. 'But I think this, the Champions League is unique. There's no margin of error. You fail, you're gone.'' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Karim Benzema believes that Real Madrid has the quality to retain the Champions League title, citing the team's exceptional players and their unity as their strengths. Speaking ahead of a Champions League match against Atletico, he expressed confidence in his team's ability to reach the final again. James Rodriguez, back from a foot injury, praised manager Carlo Ancelotti's experience and training methods, which he sees as crucial for winning tournaments. Rodriguez also compared football in France and Spain, highlighting the physicality and tactical nature of the French game versus the more playable style in Spain, but emphasized the unique challenge of the Champions League where there's no room for error.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Former Manchester United and City striker Carlos Tevez believes it is harder to score goals in Serie A than the Premier League. The Argentine, who has scored 36 goals in the Italian league since arriving at Juventus in the summer of 2013 blasted Premier League midfields as 'non-existent', and suggested defending is better on the continent. After sitting out Juve's defeat to bottom of the table Parma, ahead of a Champions League quarter-final against Monaco on Tuesday, Tevez who has scored 25 times for the Old Lady this season, insisted his task was now 'much more difficult'. Carlos Tevez, in action against Empoli in Serie A, says it is harder to score goals in Italy than England. The striker has 36 league goals in the Italian top flight since leaving England for Juventus in 2013. 'It's much easier to score in the Premier League, where the ball doesn't stop moving, the action is everywhere and the midfield is non-existent,' the striker, who scored 84 Premier League goals and won three titles, told Italian paper La Repubblica. 'Here you see a striker up against five defenders, it's much more difficult than in England. The Italian league is of a high standard.' The striker, who won the Champions League with Manchester United in 2008, believes his Juventus team are more rounded than that side, and can repeat the success. 'That was a different situation,' he added. 'There were some amazing examples: Cristiano Ronaldo, Wayne Rooney, Ryan Giggs, Rio Ferdinand, Paul Scholes. 'I think that now there is a team instead. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Passengers were forced to run for their lives after a plane erupted into flames prior to take-off. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Inter Milan sporting director Piero Ausilio has admitted being left feeling 'sad' after the club lost patience and decided to sell Philippe Coutinho to Liverpool. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Boss Nigel Pearson has urged Leicester to keep their cool and ignore their relegation rivals. Vardy celebrates in front of the travelling away fans after hitting the winner against West Brom. But after their mini-revival, Pearson wants his side to remain focused on their own jobs. 'I'm very wary of people flipping the emphasis,' he said. 'Our future is in our own hands and if we go into the last game with that we have given ourselves a realistic chance. 'We need to make sure our own run-in is what we want it to be. Leicester manager Nigel Pearson has urged his players to focus on their own job and not worry about their relegation rivals during run-in. 'It's helpful that other teams are being dragged into it. People are continually adjusting the form table and their predictions. 'We can't get involved in anything apart from being involved in our own games that may change people's perceptions. 'It's great when results go your way but they only help if you've done your own job. 'It's important for us to be in touch. One of the potential problems we have to deal with is people are now overly optimistic.'' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Leicester City manager Nigel Pearson has emphasized the importance of his team maintaining focus on their own performances and not getting distracted by the performances of their relegation rivals in the Barclays Premier League. Despite being three points from safety and currently at the bottom of the table, Leicester has experienced a resurgence with back-to-back wins, including a dramatic 3-2 victory over West Bromwich Albion, thanks to a late goal by Jamie Vardy. Pearson stressed the need for Leicester to control their own destiny and ensure their run-in is successful, while acknowledging that while it's beneficial when other teams' results are favorable, it only truly matters if Leicester takes care of their own matches.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Rangers have been fined £5,500 by the Scottish Football Association after admitting the previous board breached 'dual ownership' rules by allowing Newcastle chief Mike Ashley into Ibrox. The Sports Direct tycoon owns 9.82 per cent of the Glasgow giants but is prohibited from going over 10 per cent by an agreement struck with Hampden chiefs designed to limit his power at Ibrox. But that did not stop Ashley exerting influence. Two of his closest associates - Derek Llambias and Barry Leach - sat as directors until King forced them out at last month's general meeting. Newcastle owner Mike Ashley bought a 9.8 per cent stake in Rangers and loaned the club £5million. Ashley gave the club's old board a £5million loan in January which remains outstanding. That agreement gives the 50-year-old a floating charge on the club as well as security on a number of assets, including Murray Park and the club's registered trademarks. Representatives of the new board arrived at Hampden at 2pm on Thursday to appear before the SFA's Judicial Panel. Ashley's close associate Derek Llambias sat as director as Ashley exerted his influence. During a three-hour meeting they admitted the club had breached Disciplinary Rule 1, which requires member clubs to 'behave towards the Scottish FA and other members with the utmost good faith' - and were fined £5,000. A second fine of £500 was also imposed after Rangers admitted a breach of Disciplinary Rule 19 - which relates to dual ownership. Ashley - the world's 306th richest man, worth an estimated £3.3billion - was fined £7,500 for breaching Disciplinary Rule 19 last month.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Rangers FC was fined £5,500 by the Scottish FA for breaching 'dual ownership' rules due to Mike Ashley's involvement with the club. Despite owning 9.82% of Rangers and being restricted from exceeding 10%, Ashley exerted influence through associates Derek Llambias and Barry Leach, who were directors until ousted by Dave King. Ashley also loaned Rangers £5 million, securing a floating charge on club assets. The club admitted to breaches of Disciplinary Rules 1 and 19 during a meeting with the SFA's Judicial Panel, leading to the fines. Ashley, separately, was fined £7,500 for violating Rule 19.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'The Russian Tennis Federation has confirmed that Maria Sharapova will play for her country against Germany in the Fed Cup semi-finals this month. response: Maria Sharapova will represent Russia in the Fed Cup semi-finals against Germany in Sochi on April 18-19, aiming to fulfill eligibility for next year's Olympics. Alongside Sharapova, the Russian team includes Svetlana Kuznetsova, Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, and Elena Vesnina, under captain Anastasia Myskina. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Juan Mata has collected his player of the month award for March from Manchester United and was quick to thank his supporters after receiving the gong. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Wolfsburg dominated but needed a second-half penalty from defender Ricardo Rodriguez to edge past fellow Bundesliga club Freiburg 1-0 and advance to the German Cup semi-finals on Tuesday. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Iker Casillas has described the constant attention surrounding his status as Real Madrid's No 1 as 'morbid' after keeping a clean sheet against Rayo Vallecano on Wednesday. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A dentist who pulled out a man's teeth to try and cure his erectile dysfunction has been ordered to pay 20,000 euros (£14,000) in compensation. The patient - known only as Alex S - had all 19 of his teeth removed over four weeks in Munich, Germany, and was charged 2,000 euros (£1,435). He believed the series of operations would help him regain his vitality and also cure his schizophrenia. A dentist who pulled out a man's teeth to try and cure his erectile dysfunction has been ordered to pay 20,000 euros (£14,000) in compensation (stock image above) The dentist - known only as K - claimed to be a 'recognised healer' and said he helped the 'spiritual self-healing capabilities of his patients'. It is thought he believed the operation would help cure Mr S, The Local reported. In a letter to his lawyer K claimed that he had  healed the patient by removing his 'poisonous' teeth - adding that the patient was 'not psychotic' but 'marvellous'. But in court K said he pulled the teeth out because Mr S, who lived in woods and only ate raw foods, had bone inflammation and was allergic to fillings. An independent report found no basis for the operation. The judge said K should have recognised that Mr S 'didn't quite tick right', adding that he was not a 'normal dentist'. K was also ordered to pay the cost of Mr S's implants.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: A dentist in Munich, Germany, who extracted all 19 teeth of a man named Alex S to treat his erectile dysfunction and schizophrenia, claiming to facilitate spiritual self-healing, has been ordered to pay €20,000 in compensation. The dentist, identified as K, justified the removal by alleging the patient's teeth were "poisonous" and cited his raw food diet and bone inflammation as reasons. However, the court found no medical basis for the extractions and criticized K for not recognizing Alex S's mental health issues. Additionally, K must cover the costs of the patient's dental implants.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A teenager is in intensive care after he drunkenly slid down a glass shopping centre roof and crashed onto stone steps. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Juventus moved ever closer to clinching a fourth straight Serie A title by beating nearest challengers Lazio 2-0 in Turin. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Firefighters responded to cries for help - from two parrots. The crew scoured a burning home in Boise, Idaho, searching for people shouting 'Help!' and 'Fire!' Eventually, to their surprise, they found a pair of squawking birds. SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO. Cry for help! This is one of the two parrots who were found in a burning home after calling for help. The tropical creatures appeared to have been alone when flames began to sweep the property. But they seemed to know what to do. Both were pulled from the home and given oxygen. They are expected to survive. The fire crew in Boise, Idaho, thought they were chasing human voices when the found the birds. Treatment: The officials treated the birds with oxygen masks and both are expected to survive. According to KBOI, the cause of the officers managed to contain the fire to just one room. It is being investigated and no people were found inside. Officials have yet to track down the birds' owners.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Firefighters in Boise, Idaho, responded to a house fire after hearing cries for help, only to discover the calls were from two parrots. Initially mistaking the birds' squawks for human voices, the crew was surprised to find the birds alone in the burning home. The parrots, who appeared to understand the danger, were rescued and treated with oxygen, and are expected to survive. The fire, which was contained to one room, is under investigation, and no humans were found inside. The search for the birds' owners is ongoing.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Roma failed to make the most of Lazio's defeat to league leaders Juventus, as they drew 1-1 at home to relegation-threatened Atalanta in Serie A to move level on points with their city rival in second spot. It looked good for the hosts early on when Francesco Totti gave Roma the lead from the spot in the third minute, but Atalanta leveled with a penalty of their own and Roma couldn't convert pressure into genuine goalscoring opportunities. Roma, who was booed by its own fans, moved level with second-placed Lazio on 58 points, 15 behind runaway leaders Juventus. Roma midfielder Radja Nainggolan shows his despair as his side dropped yet more points. Atalanta captain Denis (right) celebrates with Alejandro Gomez after equalising at the Stadio Olimpico. Napoli, who sit fourth, closed the gap to five points when they beat struggling Cagliari later on Sunday. Elsewhere, Genoa lost 2-1 at Palermo and Torino drew 1-1 at Sassuolo, hindering their chances of qualifying for Europe. Roma boss Rudi Garcia reacts as his team through away two points against the relegation-threatened side. Francesco Totti celebrates after putting Roma ahead from the penalty spot after just three minutes.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Roma drew 1-1 with Atalanta, missing the chance to capitalize on Lazio's defeat to Juventus, and moved level on points with Lazio in second place in Serie A. Francesco Totti scored early for Roma, but Atalanta equalized with a penalty. The draw, amidst pressure and missed opportunities by Roma, left them 15 points behind Juventus and was met with disapproval from their fans. Meanwhile, Napoli closed in on the top spots by winning against Cagliari, while Genoa and Torino's European qualification chances were dented by their respective losses.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Napoli kept their hopes of qualifying for the Champions League alive with a comfortable victory against Cagliari. Jose Callejon opened the scoring for Rafa Benitez side with a neat one-on-one finish before Antonio Balzano’s own-goal doubled Napoli’s advantage. Substitute Manolo Gabbiadini grabbed a third goal for the Partenopei just minutes after coming on to put the game well and truly beyond doubt in the early stages of the second half. Napoli's players celebrate an own goal from Cagliari as they cruise to victory at the Sant'Elia Stadium. However, the gloss was taken off of Napoli’s victory somewhat when defender Christian Maggio was shown a second yellow card for a tackle from behind on Danilo Avelar. The win leaves Napoli in fourth place in Serie A, three points clear of Sampdoria in fifth, but five points adrift of third place Roma. Catania on the other hand look set to end their spell in Italy’s top division as their ninth defeat since January leaves Zdenek Zeman’s side nine points away from safety. response: Napoli secured a comfortable victory against Cagliari to maintain their chances of qualifying for the Champions League. Goals from Jose Callejon, an own-goal by Antonio Balzano, and a strike from substitute Manolo Gabbiadini ensured the win. The victory was slightly marred by Christian Maggio's red card. The win positions Napoli fourth in Serie A, three points ahead of Sampdoria and five points behind Roma. Cagliari's loss exacerbates their relegation worries, leaving them nine points from safety.

David Ferrer also progressed to the third round after his opponent retired due to a shoulder injury. Jo-Wilfried Tsonga won his match against Jan-Lennard Struff. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Prize money at the French Open has been increased by three million euros to over 28 million (£20.2million), the French Tennis Federation has announced. The singles champions will each receive 1.8m euros (£1.3m), around 150,000 euros more than Rafael Nadal and Maria Sharapova picked up last year. However the tournament, held at Roland Garros and beginning on May 24, remains the Grand Slam with the lowest prize for the singles champion, lagging behind the Australian Open (£1.56m), Wimbledon (£1.7m) and the US Open (£2.03m). Rafael Nadal lifts the trophy above his head after winning the men's singles at Roland Garros last year. Maria Sharapova poses with the Coupe Suzanne Lenglen trophy after beating Simon Halep in last year's final. The main benefactors will be players who go out in the early rounds, with payouts 20 per cent higher for those that go out in the second round than in 2014. Tournament director and French Tennis Federation general director Gilbert Ysern said: 'This notable increase in prize money is part of the four-year plan that was put in place for 2013 until 2016. 'Players eliminated in the first week will be the principal beneficiaries.' A general view of the main Philippe Chatrier court at the Roland Garros complex in Paris.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: The French Open's prize money has been increased by three million euros to more than 28 million euros, with singles champions receiving 1.8 million euros each, an increase of approximately 150,000 euros from the previous year. Despite the increase, the French Open continues to offer the lowest prize money for its singles champions compared to other Grand Slams. The increase particularly benefits players who exit in the early rounds, offering 20% more for those eliminated in the second round than in 2014. The boost in prize money is part of a four-year plan by the French Tennis Federation, aiming to support players eliminated in the first week of the tournament.

'Billy Vunipola (Saracens) will appear before an RFU Disciplinary Panel tomorrow (April 14) after being cited following the Aviva Premiership Round 19 match against Leicester Tigers at Allianz Park,' an RFU statement said. 'The panel of Philip Evans (chair), Bonike Erinle and Martyn Wood will sit at the London Bloomsbury Inn (6.30pm) and review the offence of striking Mathew Tait with the head, contrary to Law 10.4 (a), or, in the alternative, charging into a ruck, contrary to Law 10.4 (h).' response: Nathan Charles, a 26-year-old Australia hooker with cystic fibrosis, has overcome the life-threatening illness to pursue a successful rugby career. Charles, who excelled in rugby from a young age at Knox Grammar School, aims to be defined by his abilities on the field rather than his illness.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Mustafa Kamal's resignation as International Cricket Council president has been accepted, it was confirmed after the governing body's quarterly meeting. Bangladeshi politician Kamal resigned after voicing his disquiet at umpiring decisions in his country's World Cup quarter-final defeat against India in Melbourne last month. Kamal's remarks were described at the time as 'unfortunate' by ICC chief executive David Richardson. India eliminated Bangladesh in the World Cup quarter-final in Melbourne last month. After a meeting in Dubai on Thursday, the ICC clarified that there will be no immediate replacement for Kamal in a role which is largely ceremonial under its updated constitution. A statement read: 'The board accepted the resignation of former president Mr Mustafa Kamal, effective from 2 April, and confirmed that no replacement would be appointed for the remaining weeks of Mr Kamal's term. 'The full council of the ICC will consider the appointment of Mr Najam Sethi as ICC president when it meets in Barbados at the end of June.' It was also agreed at the meeting that ICC will write to the Sri Lanka sports minister to remind that country's government that intervention in the running of the national board's affairs 'puts [Sri Lanka Cricket] in breach of the ICC's constitution'.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Mustafa Kamal resigned as the president of the International Cricket Council (ICC) following his dissatisfaction with umpiring decisions during Bangladesh's World Cup quarter-final loss to India. His resignation was accepted after the ICC's quarterly meeting. Kamal, a Bangladeshi politician, criticized the umpiring which was deemed 'unfortunate' by ICC chief executive David Richardson. The ICC, after a meeting in Dubai, stated no immediate replacement for Kamal would be made, with his role being largely ceremonial. The ICC plans to consider Najam Sethi for the president position in a future meeting in Barbados. Additionally, the ICC will address the Sri Lanka sports minister regarding government intervention in Sri Lanka Cricket, highlighting a breach of the ICC's constitution.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers will have to plan without the services of Mamadou Sakho for a clutch of important games as the French centre-back faces three to four weeks out of action with a hamstring injury. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Stuart Pearce believes Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini deserves more time to turnaround the club’s dwindling fortunes. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Ben Flower does not believe he deserved the standing ovation which greeted his return from suspension on Thursday night. The 27-year-old, who came on as a substitute in the 23rd minute of Thursday's match, told the Daily Star Sunday: 'I was surprised how calm I was, with everything going through my head about doing the right things. Flower struggles to control the ball as Warrington forward Ben Currie lines him up the for hit.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: Ben Flower returned from a six-month suspension during Wigan's 30-20 win over Warrington, making his first appearance since being banned for punching an opponent in the previous season's Grand Final. Flower described his surprise at the warm welcome back and reflected on his need to learn from his past mistake.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'A 10-year-old Huddersfield Town supporter has been removed from his role as a mascot for Reading in their FA Cup semi-final against Arsenal on Saturday after a video emerged of him saying he hopes The Gunners win. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'It proved too much too soon for Paris Saint-Germain's David Luiz as the Brazilian was prematurely brought back from injury to replace countryman and captain Thiago Silva in the first half against Barcelona. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Reading manager Steve Clarke and his players will rally round goalkeeper Adam Federici to help him get over his Wembley gaffe. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Hannover fired coach Tayfun Korkut on Monday after a run of 13 games without a win left the club close to the Bundesliga's relegation zone. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Derry Mathews has won the interim WBA lightweight title after being handed a unanimous points decision over Tony Luis in Liverpool. response: Derry Mathews won the interim WBA lightweight title in Liverpool by securing a unanimous points decision against Tony Luis. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Roger Federer spent less than one hour on court in his Monte Carlo opener with a 6-2, 6-1 win over Jeremy Chardy. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Lewis Hamilton has told Nico Rosberg he will do his talking 'on the track' as the two title contenders prepare to renew their rivalry in the desert. prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Australia captain Michael Clarke believes Kevin Pietersen could play in this summer's Ashes Test series. 'But at the moment from the Australians' perspective, I'm happy if he is not playing because he is a wonderful player.' response: Australia captain Michael Clarke believes Kevin Pietersen, who has not played for England since their 5-0 series defeat in Sydney, could be selected for the upcoming Ashes Test series. Clarke, who will play alongside Pietersen in the Big Bash League for the Melbourne Stars, praised Pietersen's abilities and expressed that while Australia would benefit from his absence in the Ashes, he supports Pietersen's potential comeback, noting it ultimately depends on the England selectors and board.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'The MCC has announced the latest phase of its 'Masterplan' redevelopment of Lord's which includes the replacement of the 'tired' Tavern and Allen stands. The intention is to build a single new structure in their place, with more than 5,500 seats, in the south-western corner of the home of cricket - to raise the ground's overall capacity to almost 30,000. The redevelopment will increase the overall capacity of Lord's, the home of English cricket, to almost 30,000. If the project goes ahead, a new Thomas Lord Building and new Tavern pub will also be included - as well as enlarged dressing rooms in the pavilion and a 'more pedestrian-friendly entrance to the ground', via the Grace Gates. MCC chief executive Derek Brewer said: 'The south-western project will ensure facilities for players, match officials, supporters and MCC members are of the highest possible standard by modernising areas of the ground that have become tired. 'MCC is committed to maintaining Lord's as the finest cricket ground in the world, and this project also provides a wonderful new front door to the home of cricket.' MCC aims to submit a planning application to Westminster City Council this summer. A completion schedule for the new stand is spring 2019, in time for that summer's World Cup and Ashes. It is anticipated the remaining elements of the 'Masterplan' may take a further three years. The 'Masterplan', which has a projected budget of £80million, should be ready for the World Cup and Ashes.' Provide only the summary as the response.
response: The MCC has announced a redevelopment plan for Lord's, aiming to replace the Tavern and Allen stands with a new structure, increasing the capacity to nearly 30,000. With a budget of £80 million, the project seeks to modernize the facility, including a new Thomas Lord Building, a Tavern pub, enlarged dressing rooms, and a more pedestrian-friendly entrance. The project, pending approval, is set to begin in autumn 2017, with completion targeted for spring 2019, ahead of the World Cup and Ashes. This redevelopment is part of the MCC's commitment to maintaining Lord's as a premier cricket venue.

prompt: Provide a concise summary of the following text: 'Manchester City have emerged as the biggest threat to Arsenal in the race for Charlton’s highly-rated defender Joe Gomez.
